de.wwu.muggl.configuration
Class ConfigReader

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.configuration.ConfigReader

public class ConfigReader
extends java.lang.Object

The ConfigReader offers static methods to load and save settings from a configuration file. All methods might be used with a file explicitly supplied as a FileReader or Writer. If they are called without arguments, the currently set configuration file is uses.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-07-15
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Method Detail

loadConfig

public static boolean loadConfig(boolean loadDefaultValues)
Load the settings from the currently set configuration file.

Parameters:
loadDefaultValues - If set to true, default settings will be loaded.
Returns:
true, if loading the settings was successful, false otherwise.

loadConfig

public static boolean loadConfig(boolean loadDefaultValues,
                                 java.io.FileReader in)
Load the settings using the supplied FileReader.

Parameters:
loadDefaultValues - loadDefaultValues If set to true, default settings will be loaded.
in - A FileReader.
Returns:
true, if loading the settings was successful, false otherwise.

saveCurrentConfig

public static boolean saveCurrentConfig()
Write the setting to the currently set configuration file. If the file does not exist, create it.

Returns:
true, if the writing was successfull, false otherwise.

saveCurrentConfig

public static boolean saveCurrentConfig(java.io.FileWriter out)
Write the setting to the currently set configuration file using the supplied FileWriter.

Parameters:
out - A FileWriter.
Returns:
true, if the writing was successful, false otherwise.
